issues.description: The template’s Stock.take method returns a boolean, but the UML in the problem statement specifies take(String): int, and the reference solution implements take as returning an int (returning -1 on failure and the new quantity on success). This mismatch between template signature and the intended design will confuse students following the UML and prevent implementing the solution logic (e.g., comparing take(...) == -1).
issues.suggested_fix: Change the signature of take in the template’s Stock class to `public int take(String ingredient)` and update its implementation to return -1 when the ingredient is missing or out of stock, and return the updated quantity on success, matching the UML and reference solution.
